digest_items.title: Use parameterized queries
digest_items.why: Parameterized queries prevent SQL injection attacks
digest_items.fix: Never concatenate user input into SQL; use prepared statements instead

digest_items.title: Implement DMARC policy
digest_items.why: DMARC builds on SPF and DKIM to give domain owners control over email authentication

digest_items.title: Implement input validation
digest_items.why: Unvalidated input leads to injection attacks and data corruption
digest_items.fix: Validate all user input on both client and server side

digest_items.title: Implement Content Security Policy
digest_items.why: CSP headers prevent XSS attacks by controlling which resources can load

digest_items.title: Use security linters in CI/CD
digest_items.why: Automated security checks catch vulnerabilities before deployment
digest_items.fix: Integrate tools like Bandit (Python), ESLint security plugin (JS)

digest_items.title: Use security champions program
digest_items.why: Embedded security advocates improve security culture across teams
digest_items.fix: Designate security champions in each team and provide training

digest_items.title: Enable DNSSEC for your domain
digest_items.why: DNSSEC prevents DNS spoofing attacks by cryptographically signing DNS records
digest_items.fix: Contact your DNS provider to enable DNSSEC and add DS records to your registrar

digest_items.title: Verify SPF records are configured
digest_items.why: SPF records prevent email spoofing by specifying which servers can send email for your domain
digest_items.fix: Add a TXT record: 'v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com ~all' (adjust for your mail provider)
